metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0341 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack buffer overflow exists in the ec_glob function of editorconfig-core-c before v0.12.6 which allowed an attacker to arbitrarily write to the stack and possibly allows remote code execution. editorconfig-core-c v0.12.6 resolved this vulnerability by bound checking all write operations over the p_pcre buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0341` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

editorconfig - 0.12.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
libeditorconfig0 - 0.12.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Mark Esler and David Fernandez Gonzalez

criterions.comment: editorconfig-core package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.12.0-2ubuntu0.1~esm1').
